name: SendIntercomEvent
description:
Submit events to Intercom for user activity tracking.

This tool is used to send events to Intercom, associating them with a user, lead, or visitor. It captures activities and actions taken by users in your application. Useful for tracking user interactions and behaviors, including metadata. Requires an Access Token with write permissions.

parameters.name: event_request_body
parameters.description: JSON object containing the event details: event name, timestamp, user ID, contact ID, email, and optional metadata.

event_name.description: The name of the event that occurred. This is presented to your App's admins when filtering and creating segments - a good event name is typically a past tense 'verb-noun' combination, to improve readability, for example `updated-plan`.

created_at.description: The time the event occurred as a UTC Unix timestamp

id.description: The unique identifier for the contact (lead or user) which is given by Intercom.

email.description: An email address for your user. An email should only be used where your application uses email to uniquely identify users.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Intercom API
